name: Xylina Spathia
description:
'''Xylina Spathia''' ({{langx|el|Τα Ξύλινα Σπαθιά}}, English: The Wooden Swords) was a [[Greece|Greek]] rock band from [[Thessaloniki]]. 

From 1993 until their breakup in 2003, the band released five albums (four studio and one live), along with a CD single. Despite achieving early commercial success, the group avoided media exposure and maintained their artistic independence, continuously evolving their sound across albums and experimenting with improvisation during live performances.


'''The original lineup''' consisted of:

* Pavlos Pavlidis (vocals, guitar),
* Vasilis Gountaroulis (keyboards, samplers),
* Christos Tsaprazis (bass), and,
* Panos Tolios (drums, percussion; 1993–1997).


'''Former members''' include:

* Stavros Rossopoulos (guitar; 1993–1994),
* Takis Kanellos (drums; 1997),
* Giannis Mitsis (drums; 1998–2003),
* Kostas Pantelis (guitar; 2000–2003), and,
* Nikos Kyriakopoulos (percussion, backing vocals; 2001–2003).


'''Session musicians''' who appeared on the band’s albums include:

* Dimos Gountaroulis (cello),
* Giorgos Tolios (percussion),
* Giorgos Papazoglou (percussion),
* Rita Hatzinikoli (percussion),
* Fotis Siotas (violin), and,
* Aristeidis Hatzistavrou (classical guitar). 

Xylina Spathia is one of the best-selling Greek bands, along with [[Pyx Lax]] and [[Trypes]]. Today, Xylina Spathia has millions of streams on [[YouTube]], as well as various other platforms, such as [[Apple Music]] and [[Spotify]].
